title: @riot, please dont force ziggs out of botlane
body:
this is the first major meta shift we have seen in years and it happened **naturally **, as a direct result of this new botlane we could see entirely new (for the past 3 or 4 years anyways) botlanes to counter it. without having to make them batshit broken or forcing them into it (im looking at you {{champion:82}}).

juggernauts with engage supports {{champion:122}}+{{champion:412}} , assassins with sustain supports{{champion:91}}+{{champion:16}}   , mages with dissengage supports {{champion:69}} {{champion:40}} 

they're so many botlane combos that could become viable simply because of ziggs showing up botlane.

please dont nerf him into the ground because of this

replies.body:
Haven't discussed Ziggs with the team yet, but I don't see any reason why we'd try to force him out of bot lane. We'll of course need to ensure general game balance - if it's super overbearing in bot lane, it'll get nerfed for that reason. (I haven't looked at the data yet, so I'm not saying it is overbearing)

We've actually been tweaking rules to open up tower killing to more classes for a while - for example, putting armor/MR on towers and allowing penetration to work on it at midseason - in the hopes that something like this would eventually happen.
Just please don't target bot specifically. Ziggs mid is currently sporting a 54% winrate.
I think if they are going to nerf Ziggs (probably needs a small one), they should nerf the mana cost on his Q and/or the AP Ratio of his ultimate slightly. Like, 60/65/70/75/80 mana for Q (+10).

Would rather not have the mana nerf, he's already one of those most mana-intensive characters in the game, who basically cannot lane without blue buff and HAS to go Morello or Tear first to do anything.

Increase his weakness without forcing him to change builds.

Why is this a "bad idea"?

I really hope you read this reply

>if it's super overbearing in bot lane, it'll get nerfed for that reason. (I haven't looked at the data yet, so I'm not saying it is overbearing)

This is the problem you guys always have. "Well see if it's overbearing".

Then you always conclude "we like new ideas and we aren't against thembut it was doing just a bit better than it should, yadda yadda" and you give a nerf that basically makes the original off-meta idea never seen again.

I really want you guys to understand something.

When a new strategy appears, people **do not know how to counter it yet.** It will **naturally outperform traditional lanes** until people **learn how to play against it**.

A lot of what the OP is trying to say here, I think, is that if you let it be how it is instead of trying to protect people who refuse to adapt, people will come up with lanes that do well against it. Give people the time to develop and learn to use effective counters **__before__** you conclude that the new strategy is performing too well.

Of **course** a new strategy is going to perform well. If it wasn't good, people wouldn't use it. Since it's something new, people won't know how to play against it and will lose in situations they could have won because they lacked experience. **This doesn't mean the new strategy is too strong, it means people need time to learn**.

In my opinion, one of the biggest problems with Riot's balancing is knee-jerk nerfs and buffs based on populism swings and e-sports and never giving players time to learn and adapt.

I personally actually really like the whole "Seige Mage/Artilary Mage" play style in Ziggs and Xerath and think that we don't have enough of it, i'd like to see another one of those champs be made cause those are the only two i can personally name as that class.

( i really think this would be EASILY fixed by just removing first turret gold and shifting that over to Rift Herald maybe to remove the emphasis on bot.)

Then we added the first turret blood and made bot tower weaker and people realized that bot lane is the lane to win if you want to snowball hard.

Overall the amount of gold pilled into botlane is immense compared to other lanes(about 1600 gold is in 4v2 bot dive) which makes it the prime target for 4v2 dives. But if we took the 400 gold away from first turret blood and put it on an objective that's on the exact other side of the map bot lane wouldn't have to be dived so often. 

Also as a side note, the minions in top don't spawn as frequently as bot, ADC's need that extra gold but they'll miss out on much needed gold for their high cost items.
Pretty sure minions spawn with the same frequency down all three lanes
No they don't, mid lane get's minion waves faster than the two side lanes. Bot lane get's seige minions first and top lane get's them last.
You get the earlier mid because they have to travel a shorter distance, but they spawn and reach lanes at equal intervals.  Top and bot get the same number of minions at the same time all game long.

When the bot lanes match up is bad and predicted to be a bad match up the Bot laners that are countered will switch with the top laner to avoid a predictable losing lane.

Just to clarify a couple things (saw a few comments here and on Reddit that indicated I wasn't as clear as I should have been):

As of today, we have no plans to nerf or change Ziggs at all. This could change very quickly if we get better data indicating that there's a problem, of course.

----

It is possible that bot lane Ziggs gets 'killed' at some point - all I'm saying here is that I don't believe we'd make that a specific goal. 

It could end up being collateral damage to some set of Marksman buffs; it could end up being that Ziggs is OP at some point and nerfs that make him fair in mid lane make him not worth picking in bot lane; it could turn out it was just a transient fad that fades away with time. We're not committed to maintaining it permanently, we're just not setting out to remove it deliberately right now.

Have been a Ziggs main mid for a while, and not tried bot lane but can understand the issue. 
Q has long reach with bounces but should be easy to dodge as well
W has that nice hexplode on towers a 25/27.5/30/33.5/35% HP which gives people the scare that they can't hold a tower near death but this is mute fact as any good dmg adc can take that turret's HP down fast too, he just has a safe distance from it. It is his 1 OP skill and only works on Towers and not on Inhibs so I don't think it's worth nerfing without giving him a major buff elsewhere or else he's likely to not be picked hardly ever then.
E is a nice slow but only if you get them to hit and too many champs have rolls, dashes, and charges that cancel them out, the ones QQing over it are the ones who don't have that.
R is a nice ult, but has already had it's range reduced once before and it's not any more powerful than Lux's or EZ's long single line ult and yet it still got nerfed a few patches ago with how it only does max dmg if they are in the center so just moving 2 steps nullifies over half the dmg. If anything I'd call for a slightly large AOE and a 3 ring circle, Center being max dmg, middle for 2/3rd, and outer for 1/2 dmg. Since so many have dashes, like Yasuo, Jax, Zed, and Fiora who can exit it entirely as well as Flash, then maybe it's a nice idea to make it more of a good hit. Or lower the CD on it to give him more chances to hit since many of the other champs are getting where the CDs at 40% CDR on their ults are only about 25-35 seconds. 

I do like the idea of Armor/MR on towers and letting penetration work as you already DO have some of that on them already without the pen working.  And as far as him in bot lane being overbearing, it's only cause bot lane ADC/Support combos are use to fighting other ADC/Support combos, changing out for a mage/Support combo is giving them issues cause of his Q range, other mages are at a shorter range anyway usually or should be the more annoying ones that AREN'T getting mentioned that can CC and attack an ADC outside their range, like Ryze, Cass, or Syndra. However with his lack of healing and his already squishiness they shouldn't have a problem with him, it's just they are dealing with more AOE abilities and not knowing that they need to dodge until his mana is gone and then dive on him. His minion clearing shouldn't be any more than a Jinx clearing with Rockets or a Tris clearing with her E's? passive that explodes minions she kills with AA. His CD and mana consumption on his Q make it where if he uses it constantly to minion clear and push, he's opening himself to be oom when he gets up to tower and they can dive on him easily. 

I've said this is some other posts about Ziggs, I personally think he needs a bit of a buff in the self healing department as he's getting beat out by Ahri, Akali, and Ryze as well as others, in that area who have scaling healing/shields in their abilities in addition to what items can give them. Also many seem to have higher mana regen or lower spell costs as I've seen them throwing spells as often as I am on Ziggs and they are at nearly full when I'm below 50%. This forces me to build specific items to compensate for that that usually get me fussed at by my team for what i'm building, Hextech Gunblade especially as it's the best healing I can get, only other option is Rod Of Ages which only heals on spell USE for a max of 25 per spell. HGB will still give 5% of the aoe dmg, and 15% on the single target dmg. It works but requires a high gold cost when compared to how an ADC can grab a Vamp Scepter early and get the full 10% Life Steal to heal and focus on their dmg and crit items before building it into BoRK, BT, HGB, or Ravenous (if melee) to get the same or a bit more LS. With his lack of Hard CC and Self healing all he has is his ranged dmg and his W hexplode on towers to make him a champ people will pick, many are still preferring Ahri, Lux, or Syndra in mid most commonly.
Wouldn't putting MR on towers make it harder for mages to take them?

As long as ziggs doesn't push all other bot lane options out of viability (which strikes me as very unlikely), riot is unlikely to do anything over it, as they like seeing creative champion uses. I could possibly see it causing them to look at trist for buffs though, as tower destruction was at one point supposed to be her thing.

It's only when champs turn out to be extremely lacking in counterplay with their 'new' role/build that Riot steps in and tweaks things, so I wouldn't worry too much in this case.

I actually think more classes ought to be playable bot lane. One of the things that every other map position has is multiple roles. So if say dps mages are played bot over marksmen exclusively it will show either they are too strong or marksmen are too weak. As it stands no one can draw a consensus on if marksmen are strong or not because they have nothing to compare too. They are the only class that can play a duo lane and not be crippled and they are the only class that reliably siege a turret at range. So even if marksmen are weak you will have to use one. And if they are strong its hard to tell if its from team assistance or if they are just over tuned. Also bot just needs a bigger champ pool. Only playing marksmen is one thing but you can't even play most of them in any one meta. Top and Mid can play almost half of the cast without going down more than 3-4 tiers.
